text: Hello, has anyone ever implemented a paid available content (you need to pay to access exclusive/premium content) on HubSpot ?

No, but theoretically you could do it using the shopify integration You would then send the person essentially to a thank you page. Then to prevent people from just sharing the thank you page you could do several different things

you could take the easy route, and just give the person who purchased a password.  and use HS password feature or submit a HS form and use HS to determine if one of the HS fields has content for the current user, if it does, show content, if it doesn’t don’t show content
Neither is impervious to hacking/workarounds but if the information isn’t that classified and your client is okay with that , then it should be fine.
Really nitpicky... but is there any way we can request getting rid of the left and right padding for the new main HS navbar in the design manager?
looks great everywhere else in the app, but with DM2 being more full-width, it looks kinda funky
